4 researchers investigating the hacking group Lapsus$, on behalf of $MSFT $NVDA $OKTA who were attacked, said they believe a 16 year old living at his mom's house is the mastermind. 
 
The teen is suspected being behind some of the major hacks carried out by Lapsus$, but they haven’t been able to conclusively tie him to every hack Lapsus$ has claimed. The cyber researchers have used forensic evidence from the hacks as well as publicly available info to tie the teen to the hacking group. 
 
Another member of Lapsus$ is suspected to be a teenager residing in Brazil. The teen is so skilled at hacking -- and so fast-- that researchers initially thought the activity they were observing was automated. 
 
Lapsus$ has even gone as far as to join the Zoom calls of companies they’ve breached, where they have taunted employees & consultants who are trying to clean up their hack. 
 
Lapsus$ has also claimed to have breached Samsung Electronics Co., Vodaphone and Ubisoft.
